intro: Meriania, commonly known as the wax tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melastomataceae. It consists of approximately 120 species, predominantly found in tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants are characterized by their showy, often brightly colored flowers and waxy leaves, which give them their common name. Many species are shrubs or small trees, with some reaching heights of up to 10 meters. The genus is notable for its ecological importance, providing habitat and food for various pollinators and wildlife.
